snippet: Mr. Cosey recorded with Miles Davis during Mr. Davis’s most experimental period.
abstract: Pete Cosey, experimental guitarist who played with Miles Davis, dies at age 68. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Pete Cosey, a guitarist who played on many blues and R&B records in the 1960s but who became best known for his work in Miles Davis's electric band of 1973-75, contributing a sound drenched in distortion and punctuated by the wah-wah pedal, died on May 30 in Chicago. He was 68. The cause was complications of surgery, said his daughter Mariama Cosey.

headline.main: Pete Cosey, 68, Experimental Guitarist With Miles Davis
